definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: And he really wants like a home-cooked meal.
sentences.chinese: 而他很想吃一顿家常菜。

sentences.english: France is the most expensive dish Egan, the dishes are fried steak plus potatoes wire.
sentences.chinese: 法国最名贵的菜是鹅肝，家常菜是炸牛排外加土豆丝。

sentences.english: Hear Devan and Mason talk about their love of home cooking.
sentences.chinese: 听听徳凡和梅森如何谈论他们最爱的家常菜。

sentences.english: Chinese home cooking must be more delicious.
sentences.chinese: 中国的家常菜一定更可口。

sentences.english: The restaurant serves plain home-made meals.
sentences.chinese: 那个餐馆供应简单的家常菜。

sentences.english: Then I can taste the very Chinese home-dishes.
sentences.chinese: 那我就可以尝到真正的中国家常菜了。

sentences.english: Do you miss eating your mother's home-cooked meals?
sentences.chinese: 你怀念你母亲做的家常菜吗？

sentences.english: Lamb casserole makes an excellent family dish toothsome in flavour and robust in texture.
sentences.chinese: 羊羔砂锅是一道极好的家常菜，气味诱人，肉质厚实。

definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
to smell, look and taste great
mapo tofu/stir-fried beancurd in chili sauce
appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
dish consisting of stir-fried potato, eggplant and green pepper
